April 16, 2025:Wipro announced their Q4 and full-year FY25 financial results. Key takeaways include:

26% year-on-year (YoY) increase in Q4 net profit to ₹3,570 crore.

1.33% YoY increase in revenue from operations to ₹22,504.2 crore.

Strong large deal bookings, up 48.5% YoY in constant currency terms.

Cautious Q1 FY26 revenue guidance of (-)3.5% to (-)1.5% in constant currency terms.

April 26, 2025:Wipro secured a five-year IT transformation contract with Vorwerk, a German diversified group.

May 2, 2025:Wipro's share price saw a positive upturn, increasing by 0.10% and trading at ₹242.95.

May 5, 2025:Wipro's share price decreased by -0.29%, actively trading at ₹243.20.

May 9, 2025:Wipro appointed Sandeep Dhar as Global Head of its GCC Practice.

May 13, 2025:Wipro's shares saw an increase of 0.02%, reaching the market price of ₹251.60.

May 14, 2025:Wipro announced Hachette UK selected Wipro to drive its digital transformation with SAP S/4HANA.

June 30, 2025:Wipro released results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. This included winning a strategic contract from a US-based global technology company to enable innovation at scale for its proprietary operating system.

July 28, 2025:Reports emerged that Wipro decided to lay off employees due to slow spending by clients and ongoing global trade tensions.

August 21, 2025:Wipro announced it has entered into an agreement to acquire the Digital Transformation Solutions (DTS) business unit of HARMAN, a Samsung company. This transaction, valued at $375 million, aims to accelerate Wipro's mission to deliver next-generation engineering research & development (ER&D) services. As part of the agreement, over 5,600 DTS employees will transition to Wipro. The acquisition is expected to close by December 31, 2025.
